# Changing the logo and the panels

Changing the logo and the panels are the first actions you are likely to undertake when starting a new wiki. The following explanations apply to the Flamingo skin.

The following explanations provide you with basic guidelines. Please refer to [the skin page](/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Skins) and [the complete skinning guide on XWiki.org](/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/AdminGuide/Skins) if you're willing to heavily customize your wiki.

Hint: open links in a new tab in order to keep this page available for reference throughout the process.

## Changing the logo

Many methods can be used to change your wiki's logo. The method described here is the simplest of all:

1. Edit the currently used Flamingo Theme (by going to Administration > Look & Feel > Themes > Color Theme > Customize
2. Go the the "Logos" section of the variables
3. Click on the "Choose an attachment" button, just beneath the @logo variable.
4. Select from one of the existing image attachments on the theme page.
5. Otherwise, if you'd like to upload a new logo image, click "Browse", choose a file from your computer and then click "Upload and select".![LogoFlamingo.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/GettingStarted/ChangingTheLogoAndThePanels/LogoFlamingo.png?rev=1.3)

## Changing your wiki's background color

If you're using the Flamingo skin, you can also change your wiki's background color pretty easily:

* Go to the currently used Flamingo Theme as before
* Change the colors from the “Base color” section in the editor
* Click on the "Save & View" button at the bottom of the page. Your wiki is now running under a new color scheme!![BaseColorsFlamingo.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/GettingStarted/ChangingTheLogoAndThePanels/BaseColorsFlamingo.png?rev=1.2)

## Changing your wiki's panels

In XWiki you can add panels to enhance the look and navigation of your wiki.

Go to the “Page Layout” tab ( Administration > Look & Feel > Panels). The "Page Layout" tab allows you to:

* Define whether you want a right column, a left column, both or none
* Set the width of these columns to small, medium or large
* Specify the list of panels you’d like to display on both the left and the right column.[![PageLayoutFlamingo.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/GettingStarted/ChangingTheLogoAndThePanels/PageLayoutFlamingo.png?width=650&rev=1.2)](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/GettingStarted/ChangingTheLogoAndThePanels/PageLayoutFlamingo.png?rev=1.2)

The "Panel List" tab allows you to select which panels you want to display.

* Drag & Drop the panels you want to use from the middle of the page to the columns
* Drag & Drop the panels you want to remove from the columns to the middle of the page
* Drag & Drop the panels you want to move from one place in the column to another
* Once you're happy with the result, click on "Save" at the bottom of the page. Your wiki now has new panels ordered to your preference.[![PanelListFlamingo.png](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/GettingStarted/ChangingTheLogoAndThePanels/PanelListFlamingo.png?width=650&rev=1.2)](/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/GettingStarted/ChangingTheLogoAndThePanels/PanelListFlamingo.png?rev=1.2)
